ext_descriptions.ext_description: An axial_geometry_element is a select type used to specify the the types of geometric element that have an axis of rotational symmetry.
A parameter_value is the numerical value of a parameter in a dimensionless parameter space.a select type that is either a curve or a surface.
A geometric_constraint_element is a select type containing the types of geometric element that can be associated with a geometric constraint.
A linear_geometry_element is a select type containing all types of geometric element with linear properties.
A knot_specification is an enumeration of the different types of knot distribution that can be used t
A parallel_offset_type is an enumeration of the different types of parallel offset relationships that can be defined in ISO 10303.
the parallel offset relationship applies to planar curves, all defined in the same plane;
the parallel offset relationship applies to three-dimensional curves;
the parallel offset relationship applies to surfaces.
A point_curve_or_surface is a select type that is either a point, a curve or a surface.
A radial_geometry_element is a select type containing all types of geometric element that have an associated value for a radius as part of their definition.
A swept_surface_or_solid is a select type that is either a swept surface or a swept solid.
A tangent_contact_type is an enumeration of the types of tangential contact possible between geometric elements.
tangency occurs at an isolated point;
tangency occurs along a finite line or curve segment;
tangency occurs over a finite surface region.

An Angle_geometric_constraint is a type of used to define angular constraints. It constrains angles between instances of
(lines, planes, directions and vectors). It shall not be instantiated in undirected form, with no reference element, except in the form of its dimensional subtype
that, when evaluated produces a Boolean result.
If a reference element is specified, then arbitrarily many constrained elements are required to make the same angle with it.
The constraint is purely geometric, taking no account of the senses of directions involved in the definition of the constrained elements. Angles between constrained elements lie in the range 0 degrees to 90 degrees.
a set of constrained instances.
if present, a instance with respect to which the constrained elements have their angles constrained.
If no reference element is present then the dimensional subtype shall also be instanced and, in this case, the set of constrained elements shall have precisely two members.

A Coaxial_constraint is a type of used to define coaxial constraints. It constrains a set of instances to share the same axis. The constrained set may contain a mixture of points, lines, circles and axially symmetric surfaces and solids. Points are constrained to lie on the axis, lines to be coincident with it and planes perpendicular to it. For a circular element, the axis is taken to be the line through its centre and perpendicular to its plane of definition; constrained circles are not required to be coplanar with each other. Any line through the centre of a sphere or a spherical surface may be regarded as its axis.
The constraint may be either directed or undirected. In the directed case a single specified reference element defines the axis of symmetry. The element types point, plane, spherical surface and sphere are not permitted for use as reference elements because none of them defines a unique axis.
a set of constrained instances.
if present, the element defining the common axis of all the constrained elements.
The reference element shall not be a point, plane, spherical surface or sphere, because none of those elements defines a unique axis of rotational symmetry.

A Curve_distance_constraint is a type of used to constrain curves. It defines a constraint on the distance between two curves in the undirected case, or between one curve and up to four reference elements in the directed case. Reference elements, if present, are instances of .
In the undirected case no reference element is specified and the constraint shall be instanced as the subtype ; the number of constrained curves then being limited to two. This allows the minimum distance between two curves to be constrained.
In the directed case a single constrained curve is required to have equal minimum distances from all the reference elements.
Distances are measured between nearest points on the elements concerned. The distance between a smooth unbounded curve and a smooth unbounded curve or surface will therefore be measured along an appropriate normal to both elements. For bounded curves or surfaces the nearest point may lie on a boundary of the element, in which case the distance will in general not be measured in a normal direction.
the set of one or two curves that are constrained.
if present, the set of point, curve or surface instances from which a single constrained curve is required to be equidistant.
a set of instances each giving the approximate location on one of the reference elements of the nearest point to the constrained element.
If no reference element is present the dimensional subtype c shall be instanced, and the set of constrained curves shall have precisely two members.
The number of near-points specified shall be less than or equal to the number of reference elements.
The associated curve or surface element for each of the specified near-points shall correspond to one of the reference elements of the constraint instance.

A Curve_length_constraint is a type of used to constrain the length of a curve. It is an undirected constraint requiring the lengths of all members of a set of curve instances to have the same value.
The complete semantics of this entity is defined in the corresponding AIM element which contains additional constraints to ensure that the constrained curves are all bounded curves.
a set of constrained instances.
The number of reference elements shall be zero;

A Curve_segment is a segment of a curve suitable for use in the construction of a composite curve.
The complete semantics of this entity is defined in the corresponding AIM element which contains additional constraints to ensure that the referenced curve is bounded.
the geometric continuity with the next curve segment when used in a composite curve.
the relationship between the sense of the and the sense of the composite curve using this segment.
the underlying curve of which the is a bounded portion.
A Curve_segment_set is a type of that defines a set of composite curve segment elements, for use in the constraint .
a set of instances.

A Curve_smoothness_constraint is a type of used to constrain the transition between curve segments. It provides the constraint needed to define the required transition smoothness. It simply collects together all the composite curve segment instances having a particular transition code value that is intended to be preserved under modification following a model transfer.
There is no requirement for all the constrained curve segments to belong to the same composite curve. This constraint may be applied to any or all composite curve segments in a representation that have the same value of .
the set of instances of whose continuity properties are constrained.
the value associated with the constrained curve segment instances.
The number of reference elements shall be zero.

A Dimensioned_angle_constraint is a type of that specifies a dimensional value for an angular constraint relationship. If no reference element is present in the supertype, the number of constrained elements is limited to two, and the attribute specifies the angle between them. This is the undirected form of the constraint. In the directed form, when a reference element is given, there may be arbitrarily many constrained elements, all required to make the same specified angle with the reference element.
the current value of the angle between constrained elements.

A Dimensioned_curve_distance_constraint is a type of used to constrain the minimum distance between two curves, or between a curve and a set of up to three reference elements. A value attribute is provided for this purpose.
the current value of the minimum distance between constrained elements.
ext_descriptions.note: The possibility of a zero value for the distance between the elements has been allowed, to permit the case of contact between assembly constituents.
ext_descriptions.ext_description: The distance shall not be negative.
A Dimensioned_curve_length_constraint is a type of used to constrain the members of a set of bounded curve instances to have the same specified length.
the constrained length of the curves.
The length shall be positive.

A Dimensioned_parallel_constraint is a type of that specifies a displacement value that constrains the distance between two parallel line or plane instances. If the elements concerned are a line and a plane, the distance between them shall be measured in the direction of their common normal.
Distance from a reference plane shall be measured in the direction of the normal to the plane unless the BOOLEAN attribute negative direction has the value TRUE. For all other cases this attribute shall have the value FALSE.
the required distance between the parallel elements constrained.

a BOOLEAN attribute whose value shall be TRUE if distance from a reference plane is being measured in the direction opposite to that of the normal to the plane. Otherwise the value of this attribute shall be FALSE.
If no reference element is specified the number of constrained elements shall be two.
No instances of shall occur in an instance of .
The distance value shall not be negative.

A Dimensioned_parallel_offset_constraint is a type of that constrains two elements to be parallel offsets at a specified distance. The offset distance is measured in the curve normal direction for two-dimensional curves, in a specified reference direction for three-dimensional curves and in the surface normal direction for surfaces. In all cases, either the positive or the negative sense of the direction is allowed.
This constraint also allows the offset direction to be constrained in the case of three-dimensional curves. It may be used in either a directed form (with a reference element) or an undirected form (with no reference element).
the required value of the parallel offset distance.

a BOOLEAN value, if TRUE, requires the offset direction for a three-dimensional curve offset to be constrained, as well as the offset distance. If the attribute is FALSE, only the offset distance is constrained.
If no reference element is specified then the number of constrained elements shall be two.
The attribute shall only have the value TRUE when the elements related by the constraint are three-dimensional curves.
The shall be positive.
A Dimensioned_point_distance_constraint is a type of that constrains the distance between two points, or between multiple points and a set of one or more reference elements.
the current value of the specified distance.
The shall be positive or zero.
A Dimensioned_radial_constraint is a type of that constrains the members of a set of radial geometry constraint element instances to have a specified radius.
the current value of the specified radius.
The shall be positive.
A Dimensioned_surface_distance_constraint is a type of that constrains the minimum distance between two surfaces, or between a surface and a set of up to three reference elements.
the current value of the specified distance.
The shall be positive or zero.

An Explicit_geometric_constraint is a type of
and of
is the generic supertype of all explicit geometric constraints. Such constraints in general have two forms:
directed: in which all members of a set or list of constrained elements are constrained with respect to one or more reference elements;
undirected: in which there is no reference element and the constraint is required to hold between all possible pairs of a set of constrained elements.
Constraints of these two kinds are sometimes alternatively referred to respectively as asymmetrical and symmetrical.
An Explicit_geometric_constraint is either a
or a , or a , or a , or a , or a , or a , or a , or a , or an , or a , or an , or a , or a , or a , or a , or a , or a , or a .
A Fixed_element_geometric_constraint is a type of that constrains a set of instances to be invariant, i.e., to have all their attributes fixed.
the set of instances whose attributes are frozen by the constraint.
The number of reference elements shall be zero.

An Incidence_geometric_constraint is a type of that requires one or more instances to lie on (or be incident on) one or more reference instances. The inverse case, where the reference elements are included in one or more constrained elements, is also covered by the constraint. In the undirected case, where no reference element is present, the number of constrained elements is restricted to two, one of which is required to be incident on the other.
The term incidence, as defined for the purpose of this constraint, requires the inclusion of the entire incident constrained element in the reference element, or in the inverse case the containment by the incident constrained element of the entire reference element.
Incidence may be defined between points, curves and surfaces. Such special cases as collinearity of lines are included.
the set of constrained instances.
if not empty, the set of instances with which the constrained elements are required to be incident.
a set of instances, each giving the approximate location on one of the reference elements of a point of incidence on that element.
If there are no reference elements, the number of constrained elements shall be precisely two.
The number of members of shall not exceed the number of reference elements.
The associated curve or surface element for each of the specified near-points shall correspond to one of the reference elements of the constraint instance.

A Near_point_relationship is a relationship between a curve or surface and a point that lies on or close to it. This allows the specification of an approximate location where a constraint condition is satisfied on that curve or surface.
a curve or surface used as a reference element in an explicit geometric constraint.
a point lying on or near the reference curve or surface, indicating the approximate location where a constraint condition applies.

A Parallel_constraint is a type of asserting that the members of a set of two or more instances (lines, planes or directions) are mutually parallel. A reference element may be provided; the constraint is directed if this is the case, and undirected if not.
Lines, directions and vectors are regarded as parallel if their directions are either equal or opposite; similarly, planes are parallel if their normal directions are either equal or opposite. Parallelism of a line, direction or vector instance with a plane requires perpendicularity of its direction with respect to the plane normal. If both planes and other permissible elements both occur in the constraint, all lines, directions and vectors shall be mutually parallel, all the planes shall be mutually parallel and the lines, directions and vectors shall be parallel to the planes.
the set of constrained instances.
if present, the instance with which the members of the set of constrained elements are constrained to be parallel.

A Parallel_offset_constraint is a type of that constrains a set of curves or a set of surfaces to be parallel offsets of each other. It exists in an undirected form, which requires each pair of an arbitrarily large set of constrained elements to possess the specified parallel offset relationship, and a directed form in which all constrained elements are required to be parallel offsets of a reference element. This constraint is intended to ensure that explicit computed representations of offset elements present in an exchanged model can be constrained to require their recomputation in the receiving system if the details of their procedural descriptions are edited there.
The Parallel_offset_constraint can constrain a set of two-dimensional curves in a plane, a set of three-dimensional curves or a set of surfaces, but no combinations of these three classes of elements are permitted.
the set of constrained instances.
if present, the basis with which the constrained elements are required to have the parallel offset relationship.
the nature of the offset relationship defined by the constraint.
If the attribute has the value or , then no surfaces shall participate in the constraint.
If the attribute has the value , then no curves shall participate in the constraint.

A Perpendicular_geometric_constraint is a type of that constrains instances of to be perpendicular to each other. The constraint may be directed or undirected. In the directed case, a set of instances is constrained to be perpendicular to one or two reference elements of the same type. In the undirected case, the constrained set may contain either two or three elements, and if three they must all have either have underlying line geometry or underlying plane geometry, but not a mixture of the two.
the set of constrained instances.
if present, the set of one or two instances to which the constrained elements are required to be perpendicular.

If the set of reference elements contains two members, then the underlying geometry of all elements involved in the constraint shall be either line geometry or plane geometry, but not a mixture of both.
If no reference element is defined then the set of constrained elements shall have either two or three members.

If no reference element is defined and the set of constrained elements has three members, then the underlying geometry of all three elements shall be either line geometry or plane geometry, but not a mixture of both.
ext_descriptions.note: Perpendicular lines are not required to meet in a common point. The constraint will be satisfied if the directions of the two or three lines are pairwise orthogonal, regardless of whether or not the lines intersect.
ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Point_distance_constraint is a type of that defines a constraint on distances of points from each other, or from one or more reference elements that may be points, curves or surfaces.
In the undirected case, when no reference elements are given, the constraint cannot be instanced unless the dimensional subtype is also instanced, the number of constrained points then being limited to two. This allows the distance between two points to be constrained.
If reference elements are specified, up to a maximum of four, the constrained points are all required to lie at equal distances from the reference elements.
the set of points that are constrained.
if present, the set of points, curves or surfaces from which the constrained points are required to be equidistant.
If no reference element is present the dimensional subtype shall be instanced, and the set of constrained points shall have two members.
A Radius_geometric_constraint is a type of that represents an undirected constraint requiring the radii of all members of a set of instances to have the same value.
a set of constrained instances.
There shall be no reference elements.

A Skew_line_distance_constraint is a type of that constrains the distance between two skew (non-parallel) s, measured along their common normal. In the directed case one line is a reference element and the other a constrained element; in the undirected case both are constrained elements.
a set of two constrained instances in the undirected case, or one in the directed case.
a set of zero or one reference instances in the undirected and directed cases respectively. If a reference element is present, the single constrained element is constrained with respect to it.
the current value of the specified distance.

Two instances shall be involved in an instance of this constraint; either they shall both be constrained elements (the undirected case) or one shall be a constrained element and the other a reference element (the directed case).

ext_description.p:
shall be greater than, or equal to, 0.0.
The possibility of a zero value for the distance between the lines has been allowed, as a means of constraining two non-parallel lines to intersect.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Surface_distance_constraint is a type of that defines a constraint on the distance between two surfaces in the undirected case, or between one surface and up to three reference elements in the directed case. Reference elements, if present, are instances of , which includes general points, curves and surfaces.
In the undirected case no reference element is given and the constraint cannot be instanced unless the dimensional subtype is also instanced, the number of constrained surfaces then being limited to two. This allows the minimum distance between two surfaces to be constrained.
One or more reference elements may be specified, up to a maximum of four. In this case a single constrained surface is required to have equal minimum distances from all the reference elements.
Distances are measured between nearest points on the elements concerned. The distance between a smooth unbounded surface and a smooth unbounded curve or surface will therefore be be measured along an appropriate normal to both elements. For bounded curves or surfaces the nearest point may lie on a boundary of the element, in which case the distance will in general not be measured in a normal direction. These facts have implications for geometric elements defined in a piecewise manner. To resolve ambiguity in cases of multiple minimum distances between a constrained surface and a reference element, the position of a near-point may be specified for each reference element that is not itself a point. This gives an approximate location of the nearest point on a curve or surface reference element as computed in the sending system.
a set of one or two instances that are constrained.
if not empty, the set of instances from which a single constrained surface is required to be equidistant.
a set of instances each giving the approximate location on one of the reference elements of the nearest point to the constrained element.
If no reference element is present the dimensional subtype shall be instanced, and the set of constrained surfaces shall have precisely two members.
The number of specified shall be less than or equal to the number of .
The associated curve or surface element for each of the specified near-points shall correspond to one of the reference elements of the constraint instance.
A Surface_patch_set is a is a type of that defines a set of surface patch elements, for use in the constraint .
a set of instances.
If no reference element is present the dimensional subtype shall be instanced, and the set of constrained surfaces shall have precisely two members.

A Surface_smoothness_constraint is a type of that constrains the smoothness of transitions between the individual surface patch instances making up a rectangular composite surface instance. It is the surface analogue of the which applies to composite curves. The primary difference is that the transition code is now applied twice, once in each parametric direction on the surface. Once again, the transmitted transition code values reflect the state of geometric continuity at the time of model transfer, but do not constrain the prescribed conditions to hold in the receiving system if the model is subsequently edited. The provides the constraint needed for this purpose. It collects together all the surface patch instances that have particular transition code values in their u- and v-parameter directions that are to be preserved under modification following a model transfer.
the constrained containing a set of instances.
the value associated with the u parametric direction of the constrained .
the value associated with the v parametric direction of the constrained .
There shall be no reference elements.

A Swept_curve_surface_constraint is a type of intended for application in the exchange of a computed explicit configuration corresponding to any of the entity data types swept surface, or swept solid. The constraint asserts that the surfaces of the explicit configuration are constrained to include one or more curves involved in the definition of the entity data type instance that is swept, and to have the correct relation to the geometry of those curves and to the directrix curve of the sweep motion.
If this constraint is applied, and if either the swept instance or the geometry of the sweep motion is edited following a model transfer, the intention is that the receiving system shall recompute the geometry of the swept surfaces to maintain satisfaction of these relationships.
the set of instances swept out by the curves of the swept element.
a single or instance that is the reference element for the swept surfaces.

A Swept_point_curve_constraint is a type of intended for application in the exchange of a computed explicit configuration corresponding to any subtype of data type . The edge curves of the explicit configuration are constrained to pass through the vertex point instances of the instance, and to have the correct relation to the geometry of the directrix curve of the sweep motion,
In this constraint, and the previous one, the constrained elements are explicit elements that result from the evaluation of a procedural definition. The curves generated are constrained in terms of attributes of that procedural definition, i.e. the instance, which plays the role of reference element in the constraint. The constraint cannot be applied unless the and the set of explicit curves it generates both exist in the model at the time of transfer.
the set of instances swept out by the vertices of the swept element.
a single instance that is the reference element for the swept curves.

A Symmetry_geometric_constraint is a type of which asserts that two geometric elements are symmetrically disposed with respect to a specified mirror element. In two dimensions the mirror element shall be a line. In three dimensions the mirror element shall be either a or a .
For a plane mirror element in 3D, or a line mirror element in 2D, the two instances are constrained to be mirror images of each other with respect to the mmirror element.
For a line mirror element in 3D the requirement is that any plane through the mirror line cuts the constrained instances in two-dimensional point sets (curves together with isolated points) that are constrained to be mirror images of each other with respect to the line.

ext_description.p:
a pair of instances that are constrained to be symmetrical about the mirror element.
The precise semantics of this entity is more fully defined in the corresponding AIM entity.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the line or plane about which symmetry between the constrained elements shall be maintained.
There shall be no reference elements.
The that is the mirror element shall not be a

A Tangent_constraint is a type of that represents a tangency relationship between two or more instances of curve or surface. In its undirected form it requires two elements to be tangential to each other, and in its directed form it requires one or more elements to be tangential to one or more reference elements.
The Tangent_constraint does not specify a point of tangency, but it requires one to exist for the constraint to be satisfied. However, near-points may be specified, each of which indicates the approximate location of an intended tangency in a model. These may be used in determining chosen solutions where multiple possibilities arise.
The precise semantics of this entity is more fully defined in the corresponding AIM entity which contains additional rules not modelled here.
the set of instances that are constrained.
if not empty, the set of instances to which the each member of the set of constrained elements is required to be tangential.
a set of instances, each giving the approximate location on one of the reference elements of one or more points of incidence on that element.
an indicator of whether the tangencies are point contact, contact along a curve or contact over a surface region.
If no reference elements are defined then the number of distinct constrained elements shall be two.
The associated curve or surface element for each of the specified near-points shall correspond to one of the reference elements of the constraint instance.
